intro: Pristimera tetramera, commonly known as the four-merous pristimera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan, and thrives in temperate climates. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, giving the plant a delicate, fern-like appearance. Pristimera tetramera is often found in woodland edges and moist, shaded habitats.
